meanings.definition: The ability to deliver or be delivered.
meanings.sent1: The deliverability of the package was impressive.
meanings.sent2: We tested the deliverability of the new mail service.
meanings.sent3: The deliverability of the message brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: Her speech had the deliverability of a well-aimed arrow hitting its target.
meanings.sent5: The deliverability of the medicine was crucial for the patient's recovery.

meanings.definition: The likelihood that an email will successfully reach the recipient's inbox.
meanings.sent1: The deliverability of the newsletter was high this month.
meanings.sent2: Improving email deliverability is essential for marketing campaigns.
meanings.sent3: The deliverability of the spam folder made the email disappear into the abyss.
meanings.sent4: The deliverability of the email was like finding a needle in a haystack.
meanings.sent5: She checked the deliverability of her email by sending a test message.
